definition: to grasp (often fig.)/to control/to seize (initiative, opportunity, destiny)/to master/to know well/to understand sth well and know how to use it/fluency
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful

sentences.english: Russia says that Iran and North Korea do not have missiles capable of striking Europe.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯说，伊朗和北韩没有掌握可以打击欧洲的导弹。

sentences.english: The critical question is one of scale and degree, " said Nutt, the chairman of the government's Advisory Council on the Misuse of Drugs.
sentences.chinese: 关键问题是如何掌握好它的度和量。

sentences.english: He had troubles with the very elements of writing.
sentences.chinese: 他在掌握写作的基本要领方面困难重重。

sentences.english: Mix master it, that is mastered exclamatory point.
sentences.chinese: 掌握它的搭配，即掌握了感叹句的重点。

sentences.english: Mix master it, that is mastered exclamatory point.
sentences.chinese: 掌握它的搭配，即掌握了感叹句的重点。

sentences.english: It helped anchor Asia as the future of economic and technological advancement.
sentences.chinese: 它帮助掌握亚洲未来的经济和科技进步的方向。

sentences.english: Is now a tier 4 talent and is a prerequisite for the new Master Demonologist talent.
sentences.chinese: 它现在是一个4级天赋，是新天赋恶魔掌握的前置。

sentences.english: Use vocabulary learning methods to focus quickly on the vocabulary YOU need to study.
sentences.chinese: 用词汇学习方法来集中学习你需要掌握的词汇表。

sentences.english: The second is to master fire, fire extinguishing basic common sense.
sentences.chinese: 二是掌握防火，灭火基本常识。

sentences.english: Her craftsmanship improved and she mastered her sketching techniques.
sentences.chinese: 她的手艺提高了，还熟练地掌握了草图素描法。

sentences.english: According to the information that we have at this time, the incident only occurred once.
sentences.chinese: 就我们目前掌握的情况，这次事件还是一次偶发事件。

sentences.english: These are the basic operations you will need to master before moving ahead.
sentences.chinese: 在继续之前，您需要掌握一些基本操作。

sentences.english: It takes years to master a new subject.
sentences.chinese: 掌握一门新学科要花多年功夫。

sentences.english: The facts that I have now are fragmentary .
sentences.chinese: 现在我所掌握的事实只是一些断简残篇。

sentences.english: The level of knowledge is checked every half a year when pupils have to pass exams.
sentences.chinese: 学生们每半年参加一次考试来检查所掌握知识的水平。

sentences.english: The command of the accurate pronunciation of polyphonic characters is the key to the standardization of Chinese character pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 准确掌握多音异读字是人们规范认读汉字的关键。

definition: to grasp (also fig.)/to seize/to hold/assurance/certainty/sure (of the outcome)
to suss out/to figure out/to ascertain
